components.planningdetails

Class PlanningDetailsState

  • java.lang.Object
    • components.planningdetails.PlanningDetailsState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPlanningDetailsState
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AddingWaypointState, DefaultState, SelectingWaypointState

    public abstract class PlanningDetailsState
extends java.lang.Object
implements IPlanningDetailsState
    This class acts as a basis to build the states of the planning details. It implements most of the IPlanningDetailsState interface.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected PlanningDetails planningDetails
      A reference to the component controlled by this state object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlanningDetailsState(PlanningDetails planningDetails)
      Creates a new PlanningDetailsState and binds it to the component to control.

      This default method simply refreshes the view when entering to this state.
      IPlanningDetailsState leaveState(IPlanningDetailsState nextState)
      This basic implementation does nothing, extend it to perform special actions when leaving this state.

public IPlanningDetailsState leaveState(@NotNull
                                                 IPlanningDetailsState nextState)
        This basic implementation does nothing, extend it to perform special actions when leaving this state.

      • onSaveNewWaypoint

        @NotNull
public IPlanningDetailsState onSaveNewWaypoint(@NotNull
                                                        SaveDeliveryAddress action)
        Description copied from interface: IPlanningDetailsState
        Handles the "save new waypoint" user action. This is triggered by a click on the "check" icon that appears when the user finishes entering the data of the new waypoint.
        Specified by:
        onSaveNewWaypoint in interface IPlanningDetailsState
        Parameters:
        action - An object representig the user action. It contains the the waypoint object to add and its index.
        Returns:
        The state of the component after the user action was handled.

      • onAddWaypointAction

        public IPlanningDetailsState onAddWaypointAction(AddWaypointAction action)
        Description copied from interface: IPlanningDetailsState
        Handles the "add waypoint" user action. This is triggered by a click on the "add" button to add a waypoint between two existing waypoints.
        Specified by:
        onAddWaypointAction in interface IPlanningDetailsState
        Parameters:
        action - An object representing the user action. It mainly has the index where to insert the new waypoint.
        Returns:
        The state of the component after the user action was handled.

      • onRemoveWaypointAction

        public IPlanningDetailsState onRemoveWaypointAction(RemoveWaypointAction action)
        Description copied from interface: IPlanningDetailsState
        Handles the "remove waypoint" user action. This is triggered by a click on the "remove" icon at the top right of the card of the waypoint.
        Specified by:
        onRemoveWaypointAction in interface IPlanningDetailsState
        Parameters:
        action - An object representing the user action. It mainly has a reference to the waypoint to be removed.
        Returns:
        The state of the component after the user action was handled.

      • onCancelAddWaypointAction

        public IPlanningDetailsState onCancelAddWaypointAction(CancelAddWaypointAction action)
        Description copied from interface: IPlanningDetailsState
        Handles the "cancel waypoint addition" user action. This is triggered by a click on the "cancel" icon that appears when the user is selecting an intersection or is entering the data of the waypoint.
        Specified by:
        onCancelAddWaypointAction in interface IPlanningDetailsState
        Parameters:
        action - An object representing the user action.
        Returns:
        The state of the component after the user action was handled.

      • refreshView

        public void refreshView()
        Refreshes the view. It creates a PlanningDetailsItem components for each PlanningWaypoint and attaches it to its value. They are created in the order of the planning. It also ensures that the warehouse is not removable and it hides the parts of the "path" outside of the start and end.
        Specified by:
        refreshView in interface IPlanningDetailsState
